author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Awake, wary minds in quiet Nihon's keep,
In Silicon's maw, the timid yen does leap.
Like startled hares in the shadow of the hawk,
Watch dear bonds flicker, 'gainst troubling times they balk.

A yonder crossroads for the ram named Romney, bred,
In lands of Utah, where destiny is wed.
With one term past, will a new journey start,
Or will he, like the snail, recoil from the dart?

The moon's pale south, a hare's burrow yet unseen,
India and Russia in a celestial scene.
Who leads the race to this draped untrodden shore?
A gamboling goat, in the cosmos to explore.

feedItems.title: As Rates Rise, Japan Is Wary About Silicon Valley Bank Sequel
feedItems.description: Unrealized losses on bonds could hit regional Japanese banks, though they are less worried about depositor flight.

feedItems.title: Mitt Romney's Political Journey Reaches a Crossroads
feedItems.description: The Utah senator plans to announce soon whether he will seek a second term in what could be a wrenching primary.

feedItems.title: India Races Russia to Be First to Land on Moon's South Pole
feedItems.description: India is vying to be first to land a rover on the moon’s unexplored south pole—an achievement that would solidify its ambitions to be a major space power amid resurgent interest in lunar exploration.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
A conflict spun in Russian's fabled lore,
From Moscow's heart to Washington's austere.
In Ukraine's land, the dire clash doth roar,
A warrior's tale that's penned in blood and tear.

Fair China's bloom, for forty years did thrive,
From squalor-poor to great eminence climbed.
Now signs of woe and hardship do arrive,
The wheel of fortune cruelly titan-timed.

In golden halls, the wealthy weave their ploys,
With dynasty trusts, their fortunes to ensure.
'Fore tax cuts of Trump reach end of their joys,
Preserving wealth, their lineage to secure.

feedItems.title: Why Russia's War in Ukraine Could Run for Years
feedItems.description: From Moscow to Washington, a lack of clear and achievable strategic goals points to a long conflict.

feedItems.title: China's 40-Year Boom Is Over. What Comes Next?
feedItems.description: The economic model that took the country from poverty to great-power status seems broken, and everywhere are signs of distress.

feedItems.title: The Moves Wealthy Families Are Making to Skirt Estate Taxes
feedItems.description: Dynasty trusts can shield wealth before the Trump tax cuts expire.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Francisco's heart, where great traders lay low,
IKEA, the Swede, with new trappings does sow,
A bulwark 'gainst empty, for shoppers daylight,
Office serfs also find solace in sight.

In the land of the free, where the Eagle soars high,
A war takes its toll, 'neath the wide azure sky.
Over gratuity, the battles are fought,
In the halls of the eatery, peace is sought.

Lo! Hilary's tempest takes aim at the shore,
Californian lands trepid for what's in store.
Untried by the storm, now the wind's loud declaim,
Braces the South for the hurricane's claim.

feedItems.title: Retailers Are Fleeing Downtown San Francisco. IKEA Is Moving In.
feedItems.description: The opening will test a new format that the Swedish furniture company is rolling out globally—a pared-back store aimed at casual shoppers and office workers.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: America's war over tipping at restaurants has reached its most important battleground yet

feedItems.title: Hurricane Hilary Poses Unusual Threat to Southern California
feedItems.description: The area, unaccustomed to tropical storms, is bracing for heavy rains and high winds.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In the Midwest, 'neath the sky's high crest,
Lies a village full of humble nest,
So pricey 'tis to dwell there, we jest,
More like sipping wine than ale, at best.

Hark! Hilary's storm, a fearsome guest,
Bringeth wind and rain, a brutal test,
Whilst sun-bathed California takes a rest,
In God's brewing vat, a stormy fest.

Behold a man, on a noble quest,
With a perfect pen, he is obsessed,
'Tis mightier than sword, his jest,
Like divine mead in a scribe's behest.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The sleepy village that's become the most expensive place to live in the Midwest

feedItems.title: Hurricane Hilary Poses Unusual Threat to Southern California
feedItems.description: The area, unaccustomed to tropical storms, is bracing for heavy rains and high winds.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: Has this man invented the perfect pen?
